openApiSpecYaml.description: The complete OpenAPI/Swagger specification in YAML format defining the tool's API endpoints, parameters, and responses
openApiSpecYaml.example:
openapi: 3.0.0
info:
  title: My API
  version: 1.0.0

integrationYaml.description: YAML configuration specifying integration details including authentication, endpoints mapping, and other tool-specific settings
integrationYaml.example:
auth:
  type: oauth2
endpoints:
  base_url: https://api.example.com

id.description: Unique identifier (UUID) for the OpenAPI specification

name.description: Human-readable name of the OpenAPI specification. Used for display and reference purposes

clientId.description: Unique identifier of the client who owns this OpenAPI specification

lastSyncAt.description: ISO 8601 timestamp of when the specification was last synchronized with the source

status.description: Current processing status of the OpenAPI specification in the pipeline. Indicates success, failure, or processing state

state.description: Current state of the app FSM

message.description: Message indicating successful deletion of tools

open_api_spec_yaml.description: The OpenAPI specification in YAML format

integration_yaml.description: The integration details in YAML format

category.description:
Filter apps by category. Used to retrieve apps belonging to a specific group or type.
            To get a list of available categories, see the [Get App Categories](#operation/getAppCategories) endpoint.

additionalFields.description: Comma-separated list of additional fields to include in the response. Allows customizing the response payload for app details

includeLocal.description: Filter to include locally developed/testing apps in the response. Must be 'true' or 'false'

key.description: Unique key/slug for the app, used in URLs and API references

auth_schemes.description: The authentication schemes of the app

enabled.description: Indicates if the app is enabled

no_auth.description: Indicates if the app has no authentication

expected_from_customer.description: Whether the field is expected from customer

is_secret.description: Whether the field is a secret

authScheme.description: Authentication scheme used by the connector

updatedAt.description: Last update date of the connector

enabled.description: Flag to indicate if the connector is currently enabled

deleted.description: Flag to indicate if the connector has been deleted

appId.description: Application ID associated with the connector

defaultConnectorId.description: Default connector ID if one exists

authConfig.description: Authentication configuration with sensitive data obscured

expectedInputFields.description: List of required fields expected from the customer

logo.description: Logo URL of the application associated with the connector

appName.description: Name of the application associated with the connector

useComposioAuth.description: Flag to indicate if Composio authentication is used
Flag to indicate if Composio authentication should be used

appId.description: Composio App UUID to be used for authentication. Either specify this or appName

appName.description: Name of the app to be used for authentication. Either specify this or appId

enabled.description: Flag to indicate if the connector is enabled

appName.description: Application name associated with the connector

_count.description: Count of connections for the connector

connections.description: List of connections with their details and request logs count

authScheme.description: Authentication scheme used by the connector

updatedAt.description: Last update date of the connector

enabled.description: Flag to indicate if the connector is enabled

deleted.description: Flag to indicate if the connector is deleted

appId.description: App ID associated with the connector

connectedAccountId.description: UUID of the connected account you want to get auth credentials for. You can get this from the `id` field in the response of the `GET /api/v1/connectedAccounts` endpoint.

name.description: The name of the parameter. For example, 'x-api-key', 'Content-Type', etc.,

in.description: The location of the parameter. Can be 'query' or 'header'.

value.description: The value of the parameter. For example, '1234567890', 'application/json', etc.,

page.description: The page number for pagination. Defaults to 1 if not specified.

pageSize.description: The number of items per page for pagination. Defaults to 10 if not specified.

appNames.description: Comma-separated list of app names to filter connections by. You can get the app names from the [/api/v1/apps](/api-reference/apps/list-apps) endpoint.

labels.description: Comma-separated list of labels to filter connections by

showActiveOnly.description: Flag to show only active connections. Defaults to false if not specified.

status.description: The status of the connection to filter by.

integrationId.description: The ID of the integration to filter connections by. You can get the integration ID from the [/api/v1/integrations](/api-reference/integrations/list-integrations) endpoint.

connectionId.description: UUID of the connected account you want to get auth credentials for. You can get this from the `id` field in the response of the [/api/v1/connectedAccounts](/api-reference/connections/list-connections) endpoint.

user_uuid.description: Entity id of the user to filter connections by. Learn more about entities [here](https://docs.composio.dev/patterns/Auth/connected_account#entities).

showDisabled.description: Flag to include disabled connections in the results. Defaults to false if not specified.

data.description: The data required to initiate a connection.

integrationId.description: The ID of the integration for which the connection is being initiated.

redirectUri.description: The redirect URI to be used after the connection is initiated.

userUuid.description: Deprecated: UUID of the user initiating the connection.

entityId.description: The entity ID associated with the connection.

labels.description: Array of labels to associate with the connection.

base_url.description: The base URL (root address) what you should use while making http requests to the connected account. For example, for gmail, it would be 'https://gmail.googleapis.com'

body.description: The body to be sent to the endpoint for authentication. This can either be a JSON field or a string. Note: This is very rarely neeed and is only required by very few apps.

type.description: The type of request body to use for the action. Defaults to 'none'.

data.description: The data to be sent to the endpoint. This will override the body set in the connected account.

connectedAccountId.description: The connected account uuid to use for the action.

endpoint.description: The endpoint to call for the action. If the given url is relative, it will be resolved relative to the base_url set in the connected account info.

method.description: The HTTP method to use for the action.

body.description: The body to be sent to the endpoint. This can either be a JSON field or a string.

parameters.description: Required parameters for the action to execute. For example, if the action is GMAIL_SEND_EMAIL, the required parameters for actions execution would be the email address, subject, and body.

response.description: Expected response structure after action execution. You can use this to quickly check what happened with the action execution.

items.description: List of all the action tags available in composio

page.description: Current page number in the paginated response

response_data.description: Indicates if the action was executed successfully

enabled.description: The new enabled status of the trigger

isNew.description: Is new trigger. If true, the trigger was created just now or else it was already existing

id.description: The unique identifier of the trigger

connectionId.description: The connection identifier associated with the trigger

triggerData.description: The data associated with the trigger

disabledReason.description: The reason why the trigger was disabled, if applicable

key.description: The key for the CLI session

Filter apps by category. Used to retrieve apps belonging to a specific group or type.

Filter to include locally developed/testing apps in the response. Must be 'true' or 'false'

200.description: Get all connections for the current user
Initiates a connection for the given integration and mark the connection status as initiated if the auth scheme is OAuth1 or OAuth2

400.description: Failed to initiate connection due to various reasons such as invalid payload or app schema not found. Please check the details field for more information.

404.description: Integration pass is not found, check if the integrationId passed is correct and enabled.

200.description: Retrieve details of a specific connected account by its ID

get.description: Get authentication crdentials for the connected account, i.e all the headers, query parameters, etc. that are required to make requests to the third-party service directly.

post.description: Enables a trigger for a connected account and specific trigger name.

get.description: Lists active triggers based on query parameters.

patch.description: Switches the status of a trigger instance.

post.description: Sets a universal callback URL for the client.

get.description: Retrieves the universal callback URL set for the client.
Fetches logs based on connection and integration details.

schema.description: Time interval for which data needs to be fetched

get.description: List all the action tags available in composio
Retrieve a list of all actions based on query parameters.

post.description: Execute an action. Support both connected account and no auth auth.
Get the inputs for an action with NLA
Use composio as a http client to make request to the connected account service on your behalf, without managing authentication on your side.

200.description: List of all openapi spec tools

get.description: Get the status of an openapi spec tool
